ygData.subject: RE: Smithing cooking items
ygData.msgSnippet: Pie tins max at 115 and have a reasonable success rate at 80. Cookie cutters are still not trivial to me and I m at 118. Muffin tins I have not tried in a long
ygData.messageBody:
Pie tins max at 115 and have a reasonable success rate at 80.

Cookie cutters are still not trivial to me and I'm at 118.

Muffin tins I have not tried in a long time.

As a master potter on Bristlebane server, I'd be happy to create these items
for people. Give me an in game tell and I'll be happy to quote a reasonable
price. (Prices vary depending on the personality of the individual and my
proximity to a potting wheel.)

Graedon
Ranger of Surefall Glade (Currently very close to a potting wheel)
Bristlebane


-----Original Message-----
From: David Rogers [mailto:derogers334@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 2:51 PM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Smithing cooking items


From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>

Does anyone have information on the skill level(s)
required to achieve a reasonable rate of success with
the following cooking items?

- Muffin Tin (metal bit + muffing tin mold + ceramic
lining + water)

- Cookie Cutter (metal bit + cookie cutter mold +
water)

- Pie Tin (metal bit + pie tin mold + ceramic lining +
water)

Bakers just got the Dough recipie fixed, and are all
scrambling to try out the pastery items. This means
they need the metalware to cook with. Also, does
anyone have any idea how hard it is for a potter to
make the ceramic lining required for the muffin and
pie tins?

Thanks guys.

===
:D
Dave's World

believe it's true, or because they fear it is." Wizard's
